org.platanios.learn.optimization.linesearch

Class ArmijoInterpolationLineSearch

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.platanios.learn.optimization.linesearch.IterativeLineSearch
      • org.platanios.learn.optimization.linesearch.ArmijoInterpolationLineSearch
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LineSearch

    public final class ArmijoInterpolationLineSearch
extends IterativeLineSearch
    Implements an interpolation based line search algorithm that returns a step size value that satisfies the Armijo condition (also known as the sufficient decrease condition). This is an implementation of an algorithm described in pages 57-58 of the book "Numerical Optimization", by Jorge Nocedal and Stephen Wright.
    Author:
    Emmanouil Antonios Platanios

    • Constructor Detail

      • ArmijoInterpolationLineSearch

        public ArmijoInterpolationLineSearch(AbstractFunction objective,
                                     double c)
        Constructs an Armijo interpolation based line search solver for the provided objective function instance, using the provided parameter for the Armijo condition.
        Parameters:
        objective - The objective function instance.
        c - The proportionality constant used for the Armijo condition. The value provided must lie between 0 and 1.

    • Method Detail

      • performLineSearch

        public double performLineSearch(Vector point,
                                Vector direction)
        Perform the actual line search after an initial value for the step size has been selected. The IterativeLineSearch.initialStepSize must have been initialized before this method is called.
        Specified by:
        performLineSearch in class IterativeLineSearch
        Parameters:
        point - The point at which we perform the line search.
        direction - The direction for which we perform the line search.
        Returns:
        A step size value that satisfies the Armijo condition (also known as the sufficient decrease condition).

      • performQuadraticInterpolation

        private void performQuadraticInterpolation(Vector point,
                                           Vector direction,
                                           double phi0,
                                           double phiPrime0)
        Performs a quadratic interpolation using the available information in order to obtain an approximation of the φ function and returns the step size value that minimizes that approximation. This function is only used for the first iteration of the line search algorithm, when we do not yet have enough information available to perform a cubic interpolation.
        Parameters:
        point - The point at which we perform the line search.
        direction - The direction for which we perform the line search.
        phi0 - The value of φ(0) (that is, the value of the objective function at the point at which we perform the line search).
        phiPrime0 - The value of φ'(0) (that is, the value of the objective function gradient at the point

      • performCubicInterpolation

        private void performCubicInterpolation(Vector point,
                                       Vector direction,
                                       double phi0,
                                       double phiPrime0)
        Performs a cubic interpolation using the available information in order to obtain an approximation of the φ function and returns the step size value that minimizes that approximation.
        Parameters:
        point - The point at which we perform the line search.
        direction - The direction for which we perform the line search.
        phi0 - The value of φ(0) (that is, the value of the objective function at the point at which we perform the line search).
        phiPrime0 - The value of φ'(0) (that is, the value of the objective function gradient at the point
